wizard.transition.details:
Please note:
- All classes absent from the file will be deleted.
- Existing classes and groups of the classes are deleted.
- The things shared with these classes and groups are also deleted.
- The communication rules have been reset (back to default rules).
wizard.preDelete.details:
The user accounts that are not in the files will automatically be pre-deleted.
These users will still be able to access the VLE to collect their data over the next 90 days.
After that date, their accounts will be permanently deleted.
wizard.files.details.option1:
There are two accepted file formats for importing users in your school:
  • Files taken from the elementary school student database (ONDE) in the format .csv
  • Manually created files or files taken from another database in the format .csv as well
    Please note: remember to check the spelling of the first and last names: any spelling mistake will generate a username error for the user.
    Additional information on these formats will be provided once you have selected the file source.
wizard.files.details.option2:
If you want to import users by extracting information from the elementary student database (ONDE), you must upload the three following files at the same time:
  • The file listing the elementary students extracted from the elementary student database in .csv format: template available here
  • The file listing the parents of elementary students extracted from the elementary student database in .csv format: template available here
  • The manually created teacher file using the provided template here and saved in .csv format
    For each file, the columns marked with an asterisk must be filled out.

Please check the following:
  • The names of the classes must be exactly the same in all three files.
  • Make sure the parent file doesn't contain any duplicates. If a parent is listed twice, two accounts will be created in the VLE.
  • In the parents file, you must delete the lines for host organizations (at the end of the list).
  • If a teacher is connected to several classes, you must create a single line and fill out several "Class" columns.
wizard.files.details.option3:
If you would like to import users from manually created files or from a piece of software other than the elementary school student database, you must follow the following instructions:
  • A file must be created for each user profile (teachers, students, parents, staff).
  • You can access file templates by clicking on the following links:
    • Teacher file template
    • Student file template
    • Parent file template
    • Staff file template
  • Files must be saved in the format .csv (semi-colon separator).
  • For each file, the columns marked with an asterisk must be filled out.
  • Each file begins with an externalID column. This column allows you to manage account modifications directly in the CSV file. The column corresponds to the "external ID" line in the user file in the VLE's administration console.
  • We recommend that you fill out the externalID field during the first import. You can choose your own external ID, for example "RNE_teacher_1", "RNE_teacher_2" etc.
  • The externalID field allows for a user to be recognized between two successive imports and to update the user's personal information.
  • The student file must be uploaded before the parent file. In order for parents to be linked to the right students, you must specify the ID that corresponds to the child(ren) in the parent file.

accessibility.second.text: To do this, the site must respect rigorous standards during its creation and updates. classAdmin.structure.informations.source: An automatic information source means that data are provided by your school district. As a result, the verification of user accounts (adding/updating) must be completed using the school district’s software (ONDE, SIECLE, STSweb, etc.).
A manual uploading source means the school must upload its users accounts itself. To do this, you can create the accounts one by one or import them using a CSV file in the "Add users" section.
